intro: Notelaea collina, commonly known as the narrow-leafed kōhanga, is a small tree or shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Notelaea collina is adapted to a range of environmental conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for native wildlife.
